fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl

Class TreeParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.Parser
      • fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.MinimalGraphParser
        • fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.TreeParser

  • public class TreeParser
extends MinimalGraphParser

    A parser for tree data.

    This parser is initialised with a TreeTokenizer, i.e. it gobbles a list of tokens and spits out a Tree when asked for it. It is lazy, i.e. it will not do anything until asked for a graph, i.e. invoking the TreeParser.graph() method, and it will parse only once after initialisation. Further calls to .graph() return the already parsed tree.

    Parsing is done in a single pass on the token list.

    Options to setup the tree may be passed through tree-level properties in the file. These are found in TreeProperties. The best way to go is to implement specific TreeNodeFactory and PropertyListFactory which will implement which flavour of TreeNode and property list (cf. PropertyListGetters descendants) should be used to construct the tree.

    Allowed property types are those listed in ValidPropertyTypes. They can be specified as fully qualified java class names, or as simple strings as found in ValidPropertyTypes.

    Note that the best use of this class is to hide it inside a GraphImporter.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 20 d√©c. 2018
